alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Fayette; Greene (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 06 at 5:41AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Central Ohio, Southwest Ohio and West Central Ohio, including the following counties, in Central Ohio, Fayette OH. In Southwest Ohio, Clinton. In West Central Ohio, Greene. * WHEN...Until 745 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 541 AM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Xenia, Washington Court House, Sabina, Jamestown, Mount Sterling, Jeffersonville, Bloomingburg, New Holland, Wilberforce, New Jasper, Staunton, Good Hope, Bowersville, Port William, Interstate 71 at US Route 35 and Jasper Mills.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
